website_summaries.verdict: Despite disc-loading speeds that are just average, the LG BD670's built-in Wi-Fi and excellent streaming-media suite make it one of the best Blu-ray player values.
pros: The LG BD670 has built-in Wi-Fi and an excellent suite of streaming-media services, including Netflix, Amazon Instant, Vudu, MOG, Napster, and vTuner
The user interface for its streaming-media service content portal is also top-notch, making it a good choice for nontechies
cons: The LG BD670 has slower-than-average disc-loading speeds and lacks onboard memory for accessing BD-Live features

customer_reviews.title: Excelent Machine
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a refurbished unit from Amazon. Arrived promptly and looks brand new. Setup was simple and no problems encountered. Instantly recognized my WiFi. Updated the software, which downloaded and installed without a hitch. Because I am an Amazon Prime member, I installed the app for Amazon Instant Video. Again, no problems. I was a little worried that my DSL (3Mb download) wouldn't be fast enough for streaming. I selected several movies from Amazon and the streaming worked flawlessly. I haven't tried any Blu-ray movies but watch my regular Avatar DVD and the picture quality was great. I don't have a 3-D TV so I can't comment about the 3D experience. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RobertR

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive to be a disposable player
customer_reviews.text: On day one in July 2011 the LG BD670 was a mediocre player. The device generally had poor response times though the picture and sound was usually good. The software was a little flaky even after the numerous updates. Now 7 months later I wish the player was functioning even at that low level. Now it sounds like a lawnmower as it tries to spin up the disk. It won't read any of my BDs or DVDs and it even ruined one. Warranties are useless since its cheaper after 30 or 90 days to just buy new. I'm done with LG until they start respecting their customers. $150 players shouldn't be disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Blocher

customer_reviews.title: Bought this player for it's smart TV feature which worked great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this player for it's smart TV feature which worked great. I never bothered with it's WiFi since the entire house is wire networked. It took a while for blurays to load but once they did the picture was amazing. I would never buy this product again however, it stopped working after about 13 months of heavy use. By heavy use I mean 4-6hours per day. Now it just sits there collecting dust with "BOOT" on the display. I have tried several hard restarts and even called LG. This has basically become a huge paper weight until the next electronic recycling day.
customer_reviews.author: Ponce

customer_reviews.title: Versatile player; great value
customer_reviews.text: The good: Excellent picture quality; blu-ray discs are stunning on my 46" LCD monitor, and upconverted DVDs are noticeably sharper and crisper than with my old DVD player. Amazon, Netflix, and private DLNA network streaming work perfectly. Very low price for a player this capable. The bad: Menu structure takes a little getting used to, but OK once you figure everything out. Needs a very strong wi-fi signal to avoid stutters / pauses when streaming HD; we ended up hard-wiring it. Remote is weak and/or directional; must be pointed directly at the player to function. The overall quality and outstanding value, however, more than make up for these minor issues. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: No more LG products in my life.
customer_reviews.text: I should not have to buy a new blu-ray player every four years. I just turned this on to watch some Amazon Instant Video and the app is no longer in the premium section, nor anywhere else that I could search. I specifically bought this one because it supported Amazon Instant Video in conjunction with my Prime account. Did a bit of online research and they apparently decided they didn't need to let this model play Amazon videos anymore. Fine. No more LG for me. I realize some may blame Amazon, but I refuse to accept that LG could not have pushed this. Refuse to sell any LG items on Amazon unless Amazon continues to support their devices.
customer_reviews.author: bhs

customer_reviews.title: I liked my first one so much, I now own 3
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints. I would give it a 5 but its minor imperfections prevent it. The DLNA works flawlessly over both wifi and wired network after very easy initial setup. I have purchased one new retail in 2011, and two factory refurbished this season. Its smart, its simple to both setup and use. The upscaling is beautiful and native 1080p play crisp and sharp on my LCD and LED tvs. The minor imperfections include the disc drives being noisy on boot and failed on the first one after about a year even though it was used only a couple times. For me this is not an issue, but will be for others.
customer_reviews.author: cyriuslee

customer_reviews.title: Like this a lot
customer_reviews.text: I have owned an LG BD550 unit for over a year, and liked it fine, but I upgraded to this to get the Amazon streaming video. Setup was amazingly easy, maybe because I was upgrading the same brand, but all network connections were instantly recognized (using CAT5 cable, not wireless, though this unit has wireless) The interface is somewhat improved over the previous unit. I purchased a Panasonic and Sony unit before this, both of which I had to return due to setup issues. It seems like most 1 star ratings have to do with the unit being defective or hard to set up, no issue with that yet in my case. My other unit has also performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Hewster

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Picture
customer_reviews.text: I watched the new Star Wars on Blu Ray on this player and It was Incredible. This player updates automatically by wi-fi and had an update TODAY. I own 2 of these now and they both serve me very well, YET I do not use it as a 3D player yet. So I can not rate that picture. The one and only drawback to me Is The "Rebuffering of a streaming video" sometimes 3 times during a 2 hour movie. A quick Interruption. Great 2D picture with good black levels and many abilities. Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Vudu, Rhapsody and on & on. Even play music from your computer with a connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good, but can't reliably remember playback position
customer_reviews.text: The player mostly works well, but sometimes ejects discs and shows "disc error" onscreen. Powering off with the disc in the tray then causes the tray to be pulled back in and powering back on results in the disc being read with no errors. Weird problem. What really bugs me is that this player can't do what my DVD player from 15 years ago could do - remember where I was in the disc and resume at that point the next time I turn the player on. The remote has a "marker" button which seems intended to let you bookmark positions, but on most discs pressing the button just makes the "not allowed" icon pop up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi-use blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Bought this LG BD670 6 months ago, and have been very happy with it. I am using the component adapter to our TV, and the colors are every bit as clear and bright as with an HDMI connetor. I saw some reviews re problems with the DVD drive, but so far we have not had any problems. We also use it for Netflix and Hulu, and these services work fine as well. Streaming music and video from my computer works well also. My only complaint is the unavailability of many of the free extras that you get with Roku. LG has some, but there's not much news-related programming available.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis McRitchie

customer_reviews.title: Skip this if you are looking for a 1080p mp4/mkv streamer
customer_reviews.text: Although it's supposed to be supported, I couldn't encode a single (mp4/mkv) (lossless/h.246) (720p/1080p) file that would play back on this device, even with the current firmware. The errors are generic and the support forms is not helpful. Support just says it should work. Also the interface is software and the device takes time to boot up. The user interface is slow and sometimes not very responsive. However, the wireless connection is good, it's ability to connect to/find other devices is good, and the BR/DVD playback is very good. If you just want a BR/DVD player, this one does the job, but I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: This one worked pretty well. After a year or two I kept ...
customer_reviews.text: This one worked pretty well. After a year or two I kept having issues with the picture cutting out. Almost like it was losing signal or disconnecting or something. I tried switching to another HDMI port on the TV and trying different HDMI cables to see if either one worked. No luck. I have to assume that it might have been an issue on the unit. Was great while it lasted. As the issue kept getting worse, I gave in and bought a different player.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: broke after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: Keep the box. We did not. After 1 week of use, the remote quit working completely. Issue is not the remote we also have a universal remote that won;t work either. Blurays won't play, only dvds and you have to push button on unit. Contacted lg via their webpage-filled out form completely including problem. After 4 days got an email saying they could not process due to no info on what the problem was. We emailed back with description and after not hearing back for 4days, called and finally got a work order no and promise of return label-turnaround time less than 21DAYS:( Also unit was $20 cheaper on amazon within 2 weeks of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: casy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last one year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in February. Worked well until September when LG released a software update. I loaded the software update and the DVD stopped working immediately. I emailed LG for help, all they could tell me was try to reload, if that didn't work, they would honor the parts warranty but the labor warranty was only 90 days. So a DVD player that is only 7 months old is going to cost me $69 plus shipping charges to get it replaced. I think I'll use the $69 to purchase a DVD player from a different company, maybe one with a real warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Chief G

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I had a BP 320 before this and I decided to return it for this one. This player supports a wide range of formats including DivX which was dropped in the 2012 LG models. It does not directly support MJPEG (filmed by some cameras) and MTS (filmed by some recent HD camcorders), but I convert these files anyway before storing them. Netflix works fine, with subtitles, although I experienced some lags several times - I have good internet connection, and I use the player on wireless only. No complete hangs until now (they were frequent in the BP 320)
customer_reviews.author: Florin

customer_reviews.title: I got this so I can stream from my home network
customer_reviews.text: This was seriously the easiest set up I've ever encountered. I got it out of the box and had it playing movies from my home network within 20 minutes. I bought and returned several other brands before finding this one. The other brands claim to have DLNA or network capabilities but the bugs were horrible. This one is so easy and plays everything, from our movie collection to our music. It can do picture slide shows though I have yet to use that. I would recommend this for people with low to moderate tech skills who want to be able to use their blue ray player with some semi advanced options easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Plays 3D perfectly and supplies great sound. I paired this with my LG television which worked. I think there could be better communication between the two in this day and age but it works. It has all the same add on features as my television so that all seemed very redundant. I would just like to see the blu ray player show up like the apps on the television instead of the old change input method. Not LG's fault but if you are going to integrate items do it right. Having the player change the televisions input when turned on is not that special and annoying at times.
customer_reviews.author: Cheesycook

customer_reviews.title: Did not even last a year
customer_reviews.text: Had to call the company at least once a week for tech support. The CSR was always very polite. We would do soft resets, hard resets and reboots. All of which would work for a few days. Then we would repeat the process all over again. I was told to return the product for repair/replacement. When I opened the emailed instructions, I found that we would have to pay to get the repair/replacement up to $85.00. Why would I do that when a new one is less than $150.00? We will not purchase LG products in the future and we are advising all our friends, family and social networking contacts not to purchase LG also.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and full of features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents, and what can I say. If they managed to figure out how hook it up, get it all working, including the wi-fi, and the streaming apps like Pandora and weather without my step by step help, then this is easy! (they have trouble with figuring out how to work e-mail and facebook at times) Simple layout, easy to work, awesome picture and fast load times. This is one sweet little machine! They don't have a 3D TV, so I haven't got to see how the 3D is, but as for everything else this little player works excellent. Highly recommend to anyone on the market for a wi-fi multimedia masterpiece!
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Can't be used with Blu-Ray discs
customer_reviews.text: Terrible DVD player. I thought Blockbuster was sending me defective Blu-ray discs because they would skip, get stuck, black screen, etc. and then I purchased a Sony Blu-ray player for my son. I put a movie on my LG player and immediately would not play the sound, then it got stuck after a few scenes. I decided to take the disc to the Sony player and it played flawlessly, and that's when I realized that the problem was with the LG player and not Blockbuster rental. After reading all the reviews here with people having the same problem and not being resolved by LG, I have decided never again to buy an LG blu-ray player and neither shouldy you.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael F. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good Blu Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Easy to set up, plays Blu Ray DVDs well, has a pretty cool premium section that lets you stream Pandora, Amazon Prime, Netflix, etc. Negatives - The one major flaw I had found related to the netflix player. While the video was super crisp, it doesn't have an internal buffer. I have a fast internet connection and still ran into buffering issues all the time, and with no internal buffer you can't even pause it to allow the video to preload. So in short, good player, but if you're buying it for the netflix player I'd use your wii, xbox, ps3, or buy a roku
customer_reviews.author: Marina R Skowronski

customer_reviews.title: good for blu-ray, but only blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device for a few months, used mainly to play blu-ray opera disks. That's what I purchased it for, and it does it quite well. In particular, the resume function works perfectly, at least for these disks. (Though it failed for a blu-ray Tinker, Tailor, .. movie disk.) However, I have had numerous freezes when playing ordinary dvd opera disks that play perfectly on ordinary dvd players, and the wireless functions that I have tried (Netflix, YouTube) do not work reliably. Since the device was relatively inexpensive, I am satisfied with it. But, if you get one, don't sell your dvd player or your roku box.
customer_reviews.author: quiske

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The only knock on this unit is the price, which I think should come down a bit. This player looks fantastic and is at least slightly better than any Sony or Samsung unit I've owned. There are some movies that just look light-years beyond any player available at a retailer. There are a ton of features on this thing that are nifty ideas but just don't work fluid enough--like all the LG Apps you can add on. The menus and options are poorly organized and require some serious manual-study to decipher. It's 3D ready, so you're all set if that's your game.
customer_reviews.author: M. DiSpirito

customer_reviews.title: Blu-Ray 3D Wireless Network LG BD670
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Blu-Ray player that not only had 3D upshift capabilities, but I also wanted one that had true Wireless connection, without the need for a separate adapter. This one fit the bill nicely. It appears to work fine, even though I haven't tried all it's features yet. One thing I did notice, after connecting via the Wireless connection ... "NetFlix" disappeared from the menu. Not sure why that is, as NetFlix was one of the things I wanted this Blu-Ray for, particularly with wireless connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: POPPOP-DAN

customer_reviews.title: Netflix does not work anymore
customer_reviews.text: This was a good player when I first got it. Since then countless software updates have made Netflix inoperable. The video freezes every few minutes. The audio eventually goes out of sync and then I have to turn it off. LG has acknowledged the problem and is no rush to fix it. It has been this way for several months. I originally bought this Blu Ray when I got an LG TV thinking they would behave better through the HDMI serial link. Netflix is the reason I got a player with network access. If LG doesn't fix this software problem soon I am forced to get another brand.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The LG BD670 3D Wireless Network Blu-ray Disc Player with Smart TV is a very cost effective player that is simple to set up and use. Being wireless, I easily connected to the internet and was able to utilize the some of the already included apps such as Amazon Prime and YouTube. I was somewhat skeptical at first at the difference between DVD's and Blu Ray's, but after watching just a couple of movies, the picture quality far exceeded my original doubts. All in all, for price, ease of use and quality, this product is well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: P Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt machine
customer_reviews.text: this thing works correctly about 10% of the time. Every two weeks or so it cannot connect to the network and you have to go through the process again, which doesn't ever work first time. The picture quality is pretty good but it studders constantly on some days, not at all others. I've tried streaming on my laptop to see if it's the network, laptop works fine. I would not recommend this to my worst enemy. We have had problems with every LG appliance we own. Won't make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom E G

customer_reviews.title: Nice DVD player
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these based on consumer reports recommending it in the top 3 DVD players. Both play all my movies great, good picture quality, connected very easily to my home network, streams/shares/displays pictures videos from my laptop flawlessly and very easy to do. I haven't used the netflix, hulu etc yet but I think it will by easy to do if I ever want to based on everything else. Only down side is it often takes too long (10-15 sec) to process something, start a disk, turn on/off, etc. not a big deal but its not as fast as my old player at doing things.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C Valeri

customer_reviews.title: Provides Easy Access to Netflix and Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.text: This is my second LG BD670. I mainly purchased this DVD player for access to Netflix and Amazon Prime video which look great with this box. My LG 3D TVs have built in Internet ports but are not on the Amazon Prime list and will not connect. I considered Roku and similar boxes but for about the same price this box plays 3D DVDs and upconverts older DVDs and does both very well. It works well with my 7.1 receiver. It also stores logon data for Amazon, Netflix, etc. making it easy to use after setup. A great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tech & Bio Expert

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670 Streaming Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Blu-ray player with built in wireless that included Netflix and Amazon.com. The LG BD670 filled the bill. Installation was a snap as I was replacing an older DVD player that had an HDMI connection so I just swapped it out. Downloading the software update added the Amazon.com, among others. Very happy with the result and at a competitive price. Unfortunately this LG player died after 14 months and LG was not sympathetic. I could send it in for repairs for about $70 but I declined. Good by to LG for consumer electronics.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. GIVEN

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in August 2011, I didn't set it up because I was moving after I purchased it, played one bluray movie in it. I tried to play a second movie in it last week and it makes a grinding noise and ejects the disk. I tried other new bluray disks and some dvds with the same result. Called for warranty and the labor will be half the price of the unit. Not feasible and I'm not happy. The price to watch one movie is a little high for my taste. I guess I'll eat that cost and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Blu RAY

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I've used this Blu-ray player for over a year now. It works great as a disc player, but not well as a video streaming device. Sometimes we could get it to stream Netflix, but often it would not. I was told by LG and Netflix support that the problem apparently was the bandwidth and speed on my DSL line. However, since I've switched to using a Roku device for streaming, I've never had a problem, so I think it was the LG. If you have streaming problems, try a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Judson Roberts

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670 Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: As always, shipping was fast from Amazon. The product box was not packed very well inside Amazon's outer box, but with the factory packing from LG it was adequate. Installation, network setup, and updating over the web could not have been easier. This player was primarily purchased for use watching movies on Amazon Prime, and it works perfectly with no buffering using a wired network connection into a cable modem. I have not tried wireless. More usable free material would be nice, as would complete internet access, but for the money, this is a real bargain, and with Amazon prime free 2 day shipping, it actually arrive a day before I expected.
customer_reviews.author: ratman

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!!  Avoid LG products!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing in January 2012. It is now April 2013 and the thing will not play discs anymore. I put in any disc and it makes this loud grinding noise. "ERROR" pops up on the display and then the disc ejects. Reading some other reviews on here, seems like I'm not the only one. Also appears that LG does not stand behind their piece of crap products. So, I guess I'm going to have to buy some other Blu-ray player. I will never buy anything from LG again!! LG = Lousy Garbage
customer_reviews.author: J. Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased two of these blu ray players. The first one malfunctioned the first day. I called customer service and they told me that the error message on the DVD player meant that it was a lemon. Thy promptly sent me another one. We have had the second one for maybe a year. It has frozen many times and finally stopped working completely last night. I cannot retrieve the DVD that is stuck in the player so now I am out the cost of the DVD player and my DVD. Very frustrating! Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this player already for almost a month and it works great. It seams to load disks fast and I easily connected it to my LG TV. As far as the premium services I have only tried Pandora internet radio and it works without a hitch. For the price you cannot beet the performance. For all the reviews from people who are experiencing connection issues I would check your wireless router first. I used to have a router that lost the signal all the time and when I finally replaced it neither my TV or Blue-ray player every gets disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: landerx

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected/reconnect to wireless network
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great when I first got it. Then the problems began. Wouldn't play my Terminator 2 blu-ray at all, but I figured I was going to use it mainly for smart TV. Worked for a week, then refused to get back on my wireless network. Spent hours trying, moved to different rooms, call customer support, but the thing would not reconnect. Sent it back within 1st 30 days for refund. Good price if product worked correctly, but I wouldn't risk buying this brand again. My Samsung works perfectly for years now.
customer_reviews.author: Lyrax Acrux

customer_reviews.title: Netflix streaming pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: For DVD, Blu-Ray, and video files via USB, this player works great. Netflix, however, is so horrible. We have a Playstation 3 right next to it in the living room, so are easily able to compare performance. The LG skips, sputters, stop constantly - we now have it on an Ethernet cable because wireless was so horrible, though the cable solution is only marginally better. Whenever we have an issue with the LG, we would switch to the PS3 - which we do use wirelessly - and watch Netflix flawlessly. For the money, this is a terrible value. If this were a $30 player, I wouldn't be as harsh. I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: John Seven

customer_reviews.title: Very Slow
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since I had this and so all I remember is that I was very disappointed with it. It was very slow
customer_reviews.author: Xnozamax

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this is a great blu-ray player, WHEN it's working. Much like the other reviews, it loses wireless settings constantly. I went back and forth with customer service, apparently it only works well with WEP wireless settings. Not sure if that's going to really solve the problem.? Also it's does not shut off and on properly and I would have to manually unplug and replug it in, and it will say that it' "reboot(ing)." The whole thing has been a big mess I would advise going with another BRAND of blu-ray players. There's only 90 days for Labor and 1 Year for parts, it's going to cost me $70 to send it in for repair.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good, easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a solid little system, and for the price does all the basics that we needed it to do. Have had no issues thus far, setup was a breeze connecting it to our Wii, our old Panasonic VCR and our Sony Bravia HDTV. Can't complain at all, so I'll give it at least 4 stars, and hope it keeps working just fine. Next I plan to connect to Netflix (which we can already view through the Wii) and our home network and see if that has any issues, but I don't foresee any problems based on what I have experienced thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September.Used about 2x a month and is already broken.The optical drive making horrible grinding noise after I put the disk inside or press eject.It also spins in the tray when is open which should not.The ERROR sign appear on display and here goes my movie time down to drain.The drive is obviously defective,but LG does not willing to fix it for free.The cost is $69 plus shipping.New player sells at Amazon for $89 with free shipping!I'm not paying ether of these to support LG company and will never buy LG at least until they start respecting their customers.I personally think that they should make some kind of recall for this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Larry0

customer_reviews.title: Yes this is a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: My whole house is WiFi..and ONLY this product is constantly loosing the Wifi settings. It dont matter anymore because once you set up the WifI setting there are no longer any Icons left to press for the Premium Services (Netflix, Amazon...etc) Even the Update PDF they send you is wrong. It states that you must place the USB device(after downloading & transferring from their website) in the front panel...but there is no USB port in the front...OR THE BACK!!!!! or the sides. Crazy Owned this product since Nov 2011.....It's a hit or miss every time i go to use it. It may or may not work.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Mcmenemy

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second LG Blu Ray player I have owned and this only improves on the previous model. The start up is lightening fast as is the set up process. It took only a few moments to set up player on my wireless network. The streaming services are almost overwhelming. I have not had any problems but have not even tried out all of the services yet. The apps are a bit pointless. They can be fun I suppose but it is a bit more gimicky than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: JgPm

customer_reviews.title: Junk Junk Junk. Don't buy. Just get a cheap bluray and a roku
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the reviews spoke well of it as the best smart Bluray player. It has been a hassle since day one. It is slow loading anything. It shuts off randomly. It locks up often. Your wireless router needs to be about 2 feet away in order to work consistently. We've dealt with it, but now Netflix will not connect at all and locks up the machine. I simply cannot recommend this product to anyone. I'll be contacting the manufacturer for warranty tomorrow morning.
customer_reviews.author: bob senei

customer_reviews.title: Depend what are your needs...
customer_reviews.text: Do not have too much to compare with the exeption of one Samsung (returned next day) but I gues it is more for your needs. There are mix reviews on this Player and is like I said it depends if you are looking a Player that can play muliple formats, color bautiful then yes very good. The data transfer from my comp it does not works flawless some days exellent and other with hick-ups. usb never had a problem, movies exellent, netflix and all those...do not care... So it depends on your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price. Does not play sound on certain discs
customer_reviews.text: Works fine in most aspects. On the disc end though, it does not play certain discs with ac3 audio. These discs play fine in my old samsung dvd player but not on this unit. I think that this is an LG issue as the same thing happens with my bP220. Wireless DLNA rocks! I contacted LG and they had no solution for the audio problem other than to try and service the unit. i tried to explain that it's obviously a firmware issue and I'm pretty sure the message did not go through.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Amazon will no longer support this device 9/15/15. Needs to be cabled into network.
customer_reviews.text: As of September 15, 2015, Amazon will no longer support this device. Also, I had to run a network cable from my router to the device as the WiFi was causing stuttering on Netflix. Once I ran the cable, no problem. I found this to be the case at my home and at another home on a different internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Datanerd

customer_reviews.title: LG blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: This player does a great job with DVDs. However, I bought it more to stream Netflix and Pandora. When I was unsuccessful setting it up, I called the company. They told me to call my router company and tell them to change me to WEP which is 1/6 the speed. Basically, this player does not work with an "N" router. I need an OLD "G" router to make it work. The cheapest fix I can get is at least $50 more. I am going to stop streaming entirely. I am very disappointed. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Arlene S. Little

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from for Streaming Video
customer_reviews.text: I had nothing but problems using the online functions of this player. I tried two different units and both had the same problem with online video playback. They would freeze, lockup and audio would get out of sync. Worse than that, sometimes when you would turn it on, it would just be a gray box on the screen requiring you to unplug the unit to get it to reset. I finally gave up and got a Panasonic BD210 instead and I am MUCH happier!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S.

customer_reviews.title: erratic and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: We received a replacement after the first one was deemed "defective" when it refused to load disks After a few months. Less than a year later we have a player that is noisy, damages disks (there are circular scratch marks on several of my disks after attempted use) and often refuses to load or play. When it does actually load it usually performs with choppy visuals and sound. My toddlers are NOT impressed regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin W

customer_reviews.title: faulty & no support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two players, one in Mar. 2012 and one in Dec. 2012. Both worked fine at first (a little loud & long whirring during loading, but okay). As of Dec. 2013 play was occasionally interupted by picture freezing, and as of June 2014 player is unusable. All disks, new and old, experience continual freezing. Firmware up to date so that's not the problem; tried customer support to no avail. Would not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670 What a looser
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this at all costs. Totally unable to download updates wirelessly and why else do you buy a wifi unit - so you don'thave to hard wire it. A total waste of time and money. Out of the box it required an update that it couldn't download. No way to connect with NetFlix without the update so the wireless function was worthless. Returned for a Panasonic model that works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: This Blue-ray player has lots of problems: It has a fan, which makes noise It frequently and obtrusively requires software updates It frequently loses its memory of my network and Netflix log in information It is slow getting started on Blue-ray discs Although I get a great picture on both Blue-ray and standard DVDs I am really unhappy with the shortcomings of this product. This box has internet connectivity. I am not sure where the problem originates, but the voice & sound is poorly synchronized to the picture when viewing streamed programming. I am looking to trade this in.
customer_reviews.author: RICC

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say -- the dissenters are right and LG is fail
customer_reviews.text: So -- I was hoping this player would live up to the promise of those offering great reviews. Sadly, it wasn't the case. This player features a severely weak WiFi receiver that immasculates the internet-driven features unless you have fewer than 3 walls and 20 feet to penetrate to the router. In addition, the testimony of many other reviewers that, beyond the WiFi issues, the DVD player functionality is slow, clunky, and freezes on DVDs that offer no challenge to other players, is, sadly, true. And this sadly persists after upgrading to the lastest software (as of March 1), which has given LG ample time to address these issues. LG is failed!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamet

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670, a horrible product
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst product I have purchased by LG. I swear by their TVs, but I will definitely not recommend this product. It has given me problems since day one. It worked at first, just very very slowly. I thought that maybe if I updated it I wouldn't have the issues anymore. I was wrong. The Blu Ray player will turn off with no warning and will not save the place of where it stopped. It also makes some of my Blu Ray discs look as if they're defective making lines through the screen and then pausing as if scratched. When played in my PS3, they work just fine. Honestly, worst Blu Ray player I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Having tried Sony and Panasonic, which were both fraught with issues, I finally settled for the LG BD670. I have only had it for a few days but I am very pleased with the product and hence my decision. Set-up was pretty straightfoward and I was up and running in less than 10 minutes. I have not used the 3D feature as yet but I am not really bothered about that. All-in-all, it looks like an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Nikaeigo

customer_reviews.title: Item Was Defective, Not Covered by Warranty
customer_reviews.text: After about 5 months of use without a problem, the device started to make a loud grinding noise every time I inserted a disc (Blu-ray or DVD) and the disc did not play. I called tech support but since I was outside of the 3-month limited warranty, I was told I needed to pay $80 for repair. The cost was so high that I decided to buy a new Blu-Ray player (a different brand, Sony) rather than pay $80 for a refurbished model of a disc player that is known to be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670 3D Wireless Network Blu-ray Disc Player with Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: Blu-ray player is compact and easy to set up except for creating a connection to my home wireless network. The term used to describe the security code needed to log onto my security-enable wireless net work was not consistent with Windows terminology. Set up asked for a "password" when what was required was the "network key". It took several tries to figure this out. Once set-up was complete, all features worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: DennisW

customer_reviews.title: Most Things Don't Work
customer_reviews.text: This player does play Blu-Ray discs. That is the best I can say about it. It does not play DVD audio discs. The Netflix app frequently does not work. The processor is too slow to render xvid shows over DLNA at a decent frame rate. Several Blu-Ray movies have not started correctly (i.e. menu is blank or it takes 3-5 minutes to load up). Avoid it. There are better players.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Bindel

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670 BluRay player with wireless
customer_reviews.text: The LG BD670 BluRay with wireless is almost everything I was hoping for. The wireless was very easy to setup, I don't have a wired connection available for the internet so the wireless was a very important feature. As stated in other reviews the load time of a disc is slow and the available apps from LG is limited. I have not tried to find more apps to use on this unit but plan on doing so soon. Overall I am very happy with the LG BD670 and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Good commodity blue ray
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter blue ray/video player. My recommendation is to update to the latest s/w firmware release. I have had it for 4 months and it has performed as advertised. The software interface has improved through the update cycle and its adequate. If you get it at the right price (less than 90), it is a good value for the money since you are getting decent apps and a good blue ray player. It has wifi built in and a usb port in front which is useful if you like to watch portable media.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, use it for Netflix, occasionally buffers
customer_reviews.text: I occasionally use this player for DVD watching, and frequently use this player for streaming Netflix. I love the Netflix layout! It's different from my Sony player. Although on the Sony I am offered more streaming services. I do get the occasional buffering from Netflix on high speed but I am very happy with this player and will purchase another LG player like this when needed.
customer_reviews.author: L M Turner

customer_reviews.title: Just about 'ready' out of the box
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 3 minutes to get up and running, and watching movies, on this player. Playback of Blue-ray and online movies have been flawless. I couldn't have bought a better Blue-ray, SmartTV unit. 5-star means 'I love it' and this unit definitely gets a five-star rating from me. I used to be a 'Sony man' but I've been a 'LG-man' for about 6 years now and have had nothing but positive things to say about all LG electronics.
customer_reviews.author: C B D

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good features, but UI isn't responsive
customer_reviews.text: Given how much user interface technology has improved in recent years, i was a little bit disappointed at how non-responsive this interface is. It's definitely functional, and I have no complaints about the blu-ray player or any of the applications, but I always have to point the remote control right at the receiver and press buttons multiple times. I originally got the Panasonic DMP-BDT210, and I returned that one because it kept blacking out with the Netflix application. As I said, this LG has no functional issues, just could be smoother on the UI.
customer_reviews.author: NY person

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Video on Demand is installed
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to some reviews, Amazon video-on-demand is installed and ready for use on LG-BD670. Though, I should add that I connected wirelessly to the internet and installed 2 updates before using the Blu-ray player. The player has Hulu, Netflix, Vudu, and Amazon VOD installed in the "premium" apps from the main menu. The player works great. I did change the audio setting from "PCM stereo" to "primary pass-thru" to take advantage of Blu-ray surround audio that can be decoded by my audio receiver.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Last Blu-ray Player with Zoom!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the last Blu-ray players released that had a zoom function. It's also extremely compact and reliable. I've had one operating for over 5 years without a problem and it's still going strong. I got a new one as a standby for when my current one finally quits working.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: A great network Blu Ray player
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice Blu Ray networked player for the price. It has many apps built in such as Youtube. My only complaint is that the menus outside of the basic player are pretty slow. It does include an app though so you can control the player via your smart phone or tablet. It also loads DVDs and blu rays pretty quick. I recommend this, however have a bit of patience with the menus.
customer_reviews.author: Paddywhack

customer_reviews.title: Forget about using DLNA
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this item. I purchased it to show pictures and movies from my PC via dlna. Only the smallest pictures would display, larger pictures and video would show a black screen. This holds true from usb, wired, and wireless. The menu is also slow and the apps screen takes some time to display the available apps. I got a Sony BDP-S580 and it works well with USB video and pictures. Wired/Wireless video is no good.
customer_reviews.author: CoconutGrover

customer_reviews.title: can i pick a  negative 5 rating for this LG
customer_reviews.text: My player drops out a lot when I watch amazon or netflix, more amazon than netflix. I know it is not my wifi connection because I never have any trouble with netflix on my Apple Tv or my Roku. I never have any trouble with Amazon on my kindle. So I think it is this LG blu ray that is the problem. It also turns off completely out of the blue. I have read some of the reviews that said they would never buy a LG product ever again and I am right up there with them. I am now in the market for a new and different blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Seriously Love To Buy Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great for disc playback but updates fail continually and can't connect to internet
customer_reviews.text: This player is fine if you just want to use it for playing blu ray discs but my unit continually says there are updates available but won't process them. The updates always fail and you can't get around this to connect to the internet. I've tested my wireless connection and it tests fine. There is supposedly a way to download the update to a thumb drive but I haven't tried this yet.
customer_reviews.author: nc43202

customer_reviews.title: another piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with this highly rated Blue Ray Player. It accessed Prime for a short while.Now, all I can do is watch an existing DVD. I have contacted LG and am waiting to hear from them. They could not give me an answer as to when they will have the firmware to "fix" this problem. Your site says I am beyond the return date for this unit, so it appears that you have sold me a dud and I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: EdWeaver

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: It has potential of being a great player. The picture quality and all the apps are really nice...when the darn thing works. This player has the habit of shutting itself off randomly. And forget customer service. Useless. Also, wifi connect is very poor. Finally had to connect by Ethernet. Great for the 5-10 minutes it works. I love my LG TVs, but going elsewhere for a blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover/Rescuer

customer_reviews.title: Still working well
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my projector to play movies on a pull down screen. Like being at the theater! Also love that it can play most anything that is on my computer through my LAN. That's a huge plus! Means I can play things that are on my computer through my projector and onto the pull down screen if I want.
customer_reviews.author: splashy

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: For price and quality, you can't beat this Blu-Ray player. The apps are a nice feature if you have a compatible TV; we often use Pandora to listen to music while we're working around the house. The picture quality is great, even for a n00b like me who usually can't tell the difference. I don't think Hollywood is keeping up very well with this technology-- some actors/actresses look pretty rough in high-def. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amber W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: This a great little machine. No issues with wireless hookup. Of course Blue Ray Disc player is faultless. It has great little unforeseen features i.e. premium page shows time and weather along with the apps. It also shows night or day and even if it is raining out on the wallpaper. Nice touch! I had previously bought a Sony Blue-ray at Sams Club. What a mistake, I read Amazon reviews and chose a player that had an integrated WiFi system. Sony's external requirement is $80.00 on top of the player.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M. Bosson

customer_reviews.title: Great blu ray player and I rarely watch blu ray discs
customer_reviews.text: I rarely watch blu ray discs but this has been an awesome player for me. The main use is to watch TV shows or movies that I download from the internet. It plays every format I have thrown at it - avi, mp4, mkv, etc. The convenience of plugging in a USB thumb drive and watching a movie is amazing. I have had this player for over a year with no problems at all. I highly recommend this player!
customer_reviews.author: utche96

customer_reviews.title: see below
customer_reviews.text: it worked and was easy to set up.it is now 2 years later and it will not sustain a signal from the home network and keeps dropping the speed with reloading.i tested the home network with a laptop ,an.d it works fine with streaming video. i feel that they are not making these electronics to last long. it stlil plays dvd's if that is a consolation
customer_reviews.author: mark twain

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous wireless Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: This wireless Blu-ray player is such a great deal for the price that I paid for it. The picture quality is fantastic as it up scales standard DVD's to 1080p and the audio is Dolby digital. The smart TV feature is a plus and the support from L.G. is very good as the player receives software updates on a regular basis .
customer_reviews.author: Neil S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player and media center replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by the LG Live TV application and Premium content. Netflix and Amazon videos stream HD really well and looks great in 1080p. A nice step up from using the Wii, although I still prefer the Wii verisons interface. Blu-ray's load up pretty quickly if they don't have a java heavy menu. I would suggest if you have the option to directly plug the player into your router to do so. I found that streaming over Wifi is a bit shaky even over Wireless-N 5ghz.
customer_reviews.author: pixelbrain

customer_reviews.title: Streaming is cool!
customer_reviews.text: We have viewed DVDs, Blu-ray discs, streamed movies from Netflix, and tried a few other things. Everything has worked just fine. After reading all the other reviews, I made sure to update the firmware before doing too much. Installation was a snap. The remote has so many buttons that are unusual that I think it would be difficult to add to my Logitech Harmony One. So now we are up to two remotes instead of just one. That is really the only downside we have found, and we can live with it because it does so many things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D BD player
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the negative reviews are talking about...unless I just got lucky....but this product works great and synced with my LG TV remote just fine. I didn't have to anything to get the wireless to connect it brought my network up in 5 seconds. Discs play fine and the 3D quality is great. For the price you can't beat it.....especially because I can stream my Netflix and Hulu Plus flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: justinb7266

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated at the poor streaming
customer_reviews.text: The blu-rays play well, but the streaming (Netflix and Amazon) is terrible. It fastforwards by itself; the voices don't sink; the remote control takes forever to do what you want it to do, even if you're standing right in front of it. I know it isn't my internet (the router is right next to it!) because Netflix works fine from the Playstation. Totally disappointed and wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mama24

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player and I am well pleased. I did a lot of comparison of features vs price. I felt this player gave me the most for the money. I wasn't looking for a high end player, just something basic that would also do streaming video. It was easy to setup. The remote is easy to read and use. The only complaint is the slow software updating.
customer_reviews.author: Just Peachy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible build quality and streaming software lag
customer_reviews.text: I had the BD670 for 3 weeks and the rotational mechanism started to make noise and then disks became unreadable. I returned the unit. This makes the 2nd lg model that I've had to return. First a bd550 now the bd670. The menus and playback on the bd670 was just too much for this unit. I thought that this was the end all be all playback device and it turned out to be a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Swint

customer_reviews.title: NO HULU
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this player is great except...HULU REMOVED. I called LG to confirm this. They have removed Hulu and as of now there are no plans to place it back. That is one of the main reasons we got the player, but from hearing the horrible reviews of Hulu working on the device maybe it is for the best until they can fix the app. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: kthanid

customer_reviews.title: LG 3D Blue Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The LG Bd670 blue ray player came in before the LG 5600 tv but still works nice even though I hooked it to a conventional tv with composite inputs. I went to Netgear genie.com to find the password for my netgear wi fi connetion. While I wait for the smart tv to come in I joined netflix and can stream movies through the blue ray and play with the LG apps that are linked to the internet and can navigate to stream music etc. Although there are limited apps they work fine and are easy to navigate for the kids. The player and the seller are both 5 stars and I recommend both.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: New With Trouble
customer_reviews.text: We watched 2 movies with this player. Worked great, but went to load another DVD the next day, and the tray would not come out. Called LG, and they are having me send it back to them in Alabama. They also said it would take 2-3 days just to receive the email containing the shipping labels. As far as I am concerned, this should not happen 2 days into using this player. So I can not give it a good review. More to come after I recieve it back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jimshoer

customer_reviews.title: Still works great after all these years!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Blu-ray player. We bought it years ago and still use it. I often hook my external hard drive up to it to watch videos off of that. Yes, it's a little slow and cumbersome if you're trying to use the app features (Netflix, etc), but we just don't bother with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jina

customer_reviews.title: Terrific player!
customer_reviews.text: This player was very easy to set up. The instructions were easy to read and follow. Everything worked as described. DVD player was up and running with Amazon streaming video in less than 30 minutes. The menus are intuitive and easy to understand. The upconvert feature works really well. Standard DVDs look noticeably better. I am very pleased with this player and would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Kick ass
customer_reviews.text: ABT sent out my order right away and I received the next day, since they are a few towns away. The images are great, I played a DVD and it was what we were hoping for, a nice HD image. Also the set up to the internet was 5 minutes and streaming from Netflix was smooth. I haven't tried all the Apps and probably won't since there are so many of them. I'm always pleased with LG electronics and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for dvds and blu-rays, poor streaming quality
customer_reviews.text: i have an apple tv and this 'smart' blu-ray player. both connect to my netflix account via wireless internet, but the blu-ray is MUCH slower than the apple tv, and the streaming quality is much lower. it takes forever to load, buffers a lot, and basically i just use it as a dvd player now. the apple tv works great for netflix instead! my roku is also faster than this blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie B.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 12 months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product at first. Good interface, easy to navigate. A bit long to load, but not a deal breaker. Started having problems around 8 months, where disc would not load. Problem got worse and worse, and eventually would not play any disc. Some grinding sound inside unit, sounded like it was going to blow up. Went online and found out, I was not the only one. Just bought a Sony. This was a waste of money. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JBMcK

customer_reviews.title: Overall - It's an OK product.
customer_reviews.text: When I received it the packaging was good. No rips or tears in the packaging. It was easy to open. Setting up the wiring was a breeze, with no problems at all. However, for those who aren't very good with tech (like myself), it may be difficult to set up the internet connection. I myself could find no detailed instruction on how to connect it to my internet. It took me a day or two to figure it out. Also, the tray makes a loud rasping/grating noise when it opens and closes. It does not come with an HDMI cable either.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen626

customer_reviews.title: LG Blu-Ray
customer_reviews.text: As I have not been one to purchase the latest technology, I was both surprised and pleased that LG still makes a Blu-Ray player that can be connected to an older color TV (non-HD). I don't have many Blu-Ray DVDs but numerous standard and the desire to wirelessly stream Netflix etc to my TV. This player does what I need without requiring the purchase of a new TV. I have only used it a week but have had no serious problems with any of the features.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: This player had consistent problems with being unable to read discs (DVD and Blu-ray) and frequently stuttered (not between chapters, but all throughout the movies) while playing discs. I own an LG HDTV and called LG for support and followed manual instructions and phone recommendations to correct the problem, but was never able to resolve the issue. So, I sent the player back and asked for a brand new replacement only to have the same problems with the replacement, which I returned. I would not recommend this Blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Is quisnam audit

customer_reviews.title: Netflix and Hulu+ function are awful
customer_reviews.text: We have had this player since Jan 2012. We have continually had problems with the use of Netflix and Hulu+. Failure to connect, failure to play shows, disconnecting during a show, pausing, stopping, etc. LG blames netflix and Hulu. Netflix and Hulu just give you worthless resets and restarts and wait till the next upgrade. Since every other device I have, iPhone, laptop, Wii, Mac, all play fine I blame LG. This player needs to be recalled. Don't buy. I gave it a one because I can't give 0.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brad

customer_reviews.title: LG BD670 Blu-Ray Disk Player failure
customer_reviews.text: I wonder if this unit is a 'lemon' case. I purchased the LG BD670 on June 5, 2011. I always exercise extreme caution when handling or connecting electronic products. I used this player mostly with Netflix, which started failing since December 2011. Since I got this player, I played only about 5 disks. Today, Feb 12, 2012, the unit started rejecting every disk I inserted, after making a lot of grinding spinning noise. It looks like this unit is self destructing itself. I think this tells everything about this product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Does Everything
customer_reviews.text: Plays CDs, DVDs & Blu-rays -check, plays videos from a hard drive plugged into USB port-check, streams movies from all major services(Netflix, HULU, Amazon, etc.)-check. Plays movies from Network Attached Storage-check, plays movies from another PC on your network-check. Sure, the navigation through its menus is clunky and slow, but considering all it can do, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D BluRay player
customer_reviews.text: Works great, synced right up with my LG 3D TV. Has tons of apps available. I love that it's both wireless (required for pocket Blu app) and wired Internet for when I need faster streaming. Remote works my TV and sound bar so there's less clutter. Great unit at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Margo W.

product_meta.title: LG BD670 3D Wireless Network Blu-ray Disc Player with Smart TV
product_meta.description:
When is a Blu-ray disc player more than a Blu-ray disc player? When it's the LG BD670 3D Wireless Network Blu-ray Disc Player. Through the use of your WiFi network, you'll enjoy even more anvenues of home video entertainment than you've ever imagined.

If you want stunning Full HD 1080p and the unlimited possibilities of entertainment access, you've found it with the BD670 Network Blu-ray Disc Player. With Smart TV Access you get thousands of movies, Apps, shows and online videos straight to your TV from your wireless Internet connection at home. This is a Blu-ray player that delivers the best in HD up to 1080p, while setting your entertainment free in more ways than one. 

Making old just like new. No need to go out and replace your old DVD collection. Even they look better on Blu-ray. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs with 1080p up scaling via HDMI output. Dolby Digital Plus lets you experience all of the enveloping surround sound that Blu-ray Disc, high-definition (HD) broadcast, and streamed and downloaded media make possible. AMAZON.COM


(March 2011)



INTERNET-READY DEVICES


Internet-ready devices use your broadband connection to deliver dynamic content to your television, whether it's streaming video from Netflix or a quick glance at today's weather forecast.

Although there is overlap, each manufacturer offers a unique bundle of free or paid services, including streaming video and music, social networking apps, online photo galleries, news and financial updates, weather info, sports scores, and a variety of other smartphone-like applications.

Manufacturers continue to add new content to their offerings, keeping customers current through firmware updates, and making a bit of research a prudent step in your buying decision.

Learn more about Internet-ready devices and HDTVs, how they work, what services are offered by different manufacturers, and exactly what you'll need to get started at our Internet TV 101 customer center.

access, you've found it with
the BD670 Network Blu-ray Disc Player. With LG Smart TV* Access and Integrated Wi-Fi Connectivity, you get thousands of movies, Apps, shows and online videos straight to your TV from your wireless Internet connection at home. This is a Blu-ray player that delivers the best in HD, while setting your entertainment free in more ways than one.






KEY TECHNOLOGIES 


UNLIMITED ENTERTAINMENT WITH LG SMART TV ACCESS.
What good is all the entertainment in the world if you can't find what you want quickly and easily? With LG Smart TV enabled Blu-ray Disc Players you get a customizable Home Dashboard so you can find exactly what you want.





UPGRADE YOUR HOME ENTERTAINMENT EXPERIENCE.
With Blu-ray and Blu-ray 3D you can enjoy all the latest movies in full 1080p picture resolution. Better yet, our line of Blu-ray Disc Players upscales existing DVDs to near HD quality.








WIRELESS CONNECTIVITY.
Less clutter. More possibilities. Cut loose from messy wires. Integrated Wi-Fi Connectivity allows you take advantage of Internet Entertainment Access from any available Wi-Fi connection, anywhere in its range.









LG BD670's built-in Wi-Fi and excellent streaming-media suite make it one of the best Blu-ray player values... one of our favorite Blu-ray players of the year.

CNET - 04/28/2011





ADDITIONAL FEATURES DLNA CERTIFIED.
Access to videos, photos and music from your home network through this DLNA certified media player. This feature brings digital entertainment libraries within easy reach to the big screen.

INTERNET APPS.Supports LG App Store, Netflix, Vudu, CinemaNow, YouTube, Pandora, Picasa, AccuWeather, MusicID, Blu-ray BonusView, Blu-ray BD Live 


MAKING OLD JUST LIKE NEW.
No need to go out and replace your old DVD collection. Even they look better on Blu-ray. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs with 1080p upscaling via HDMI output.

EXPRESS REACTION STARTUP.
A quick-opening tray-ready to play before you hit the couch.

DOLBY TRUEHD DIGITAL PLUS.
Dolby Digital Plus lets you experience all of the enveloping surround sound that Blu-ray Disc, high-definition (HD) broadcast, and streamed and downloaded media make possible. With up to 7.1 channels of premium-quality surround sound, you'll follow the action with your eyes and your ears.

DTS-HD MASTER AUDIO.
DTS-HD transforms your entertainment experience bringing movies, music, and gaming to life. It is the ultimate digital audio complement to high definition video and can deliver a surround audio experience that the artist intended.

MEMORIES ON THE BIG SCREEN.
Want to view a highlight reel of the family vacation in the comfort of your living room? USB Media Host lets you view family photos, watch videos and listen to music from USB storage devices.

ARE YOUR REMOTE CONTROLS TAKING OVER YOUR LIVING ROOM?
Now, with SimpLink you can easily set up and control all of your HDMI connected LG devices with just one remote.

* Wireless Internet connection & certain subscriptions required and sold separately. The Magic Motion Remote does not come equipped with all LG Smart TV enabled TVs and a separate purchase may be required. The Hulu Plus service is projected to be available via a firmware update in June 2011.
